summary: The document comprises records from the Assassination Records Review Board, focusing on staff payroll records for the House Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA). It details the status of document releases, reasons for postponements, including privacy concerns over Social Security numbers, and specifics on payroll authorization for John W. Hornbeck, appointed as Staff Counsel. Additionally, it outlines procedural requirements for payroll certification in the U.S. House of Representatives, emphasizing the need to disclose any familial relationships to current Members of Congress. The document's next review was scheduled for 2017, underscoring its historical significance.
key_findings: Postponement of document release was due to privacy concerns over Social Security numbers.
John W. Hornbeck was appointed Staff Counsel at an annual salary of $34,000, effective September 19, 1977.
Procedural requirements for payroll certification include disclosing familial relationships to current Members of Congress.
The document's next review date was set for 2017, highlighting its long-term historical and confidentiality importance.
